db:abstract.db:para: This type was introduced in Qt 5.1.

db:listitem.db:para: ApplicationWindow is part of Application WindowButtons and Controls

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: ApplicationWindow is a Window that adds convenience for positioning items, such as MenuBar, ToolBar, and StatusBar in a platform independent manner.

db:note.db:para: By default, an ApplicationWindow is not visible.

db:section.db:para: The Qt Quick Controls - Gallery example is a good starting point to explore this type.

db:section.db:title: contentItem : ContentItem
db:section.db:para: This group holds the size constraints of the content item. This is the area between the ToolBar and the StatusBar. The ApplicationWindow will use this as input when calculating the effective size constraints of the actual window. It holds these 6 properties for describing the minimum, implicit and maximum sizes:

db:td.db:para: The minimum width of the content item.
The minimum height of the content item.
The implicit width of the content item.
The implicit height of the content item.
The maximum width of the content item.
The maximum height of the content item.

db:section.db:title: menuBar : MenuBar
db:section.db:para: By default, this value is not set.

db:section.db:title: statusBar : Item
db:section.db:para: This property holds the status bar Item.
It can be set to any Item type, but is generally used with StatusBar.
By default, this value is not set. When you set the status bar item, it will be anchored automatically into the application window.

db:section.db:title: style : Component
db:section.db:para: The style Component for the window.

db:member.db:link: Qt Quick Controls Styles QML Types

db:section.db:title: toolBar : Item
db:section.db:para: This property holds the toolbar Item.
It can be set to any Item type, but is generally used with ToolBar.
By default, this value is not set. When you set the toolbar item, it will be anchored automatically into the application window.
